channel.title: word2vec on Memo Tut
channel.description: Recent content in word2vec on Memo Tut

item.title: [Python] I tried to analyze the hearing survey results with text mining
item.description: #Background It seems that you conducted an interview with a resident in a certain area in a study by a certain university at a certain university, but there was something unconsciously aware of the people in that area based on the content of the hearing. I decided to try it because I wanted to analyze it. Used MeCab This is also a familiar morphological analysis engine. What is morphological analysis?

item.title: [Python] Understanding Word2Vec
item.description: #Introduction I have summarized what I have learned about Word2Vec, which is now a standard method for natural language processing. The outline of the algorithm is organized and the model is created using the library. ##reference I have referred to the following to understand Word2Vec. Deep Learning from Zero ‚ù∑-Natural Language Processing EditionK.Saito(Author) How to understand Word2vec with pictures Efficient Estimation of Word Representations in Vector Space (Original paper) gensim API reference #Word2Vec overview The following describes the concept of natural language processing, which is the premise of Word2Vec.

item.title: [Python] Sentiment analysis with Python (word2vec)
item.description: I recently attended a Python study group sponsored by Team Zet Co., Ltd. The theme this time is "text emotion using word2vec “Analysis.” Honestly, it was a pungent theme for me who first touched Python a week ago, but maybe I’m going to experience how the grammar I’m studying now is being put into shape. I rushed into the train one day before the event. By the way, let’s leave this foreword and go into the main subject.

item.title: [Python] Employee 2vec: Extract member characteristics from Slack history and visualize organizational structure
item.description: It is the 7th day of [ABEJA Advent Calendar](https://qiita.com/advent-calendar/2019/abeja). #Introduction Last time, I dropped a piece of information that couldn’t make a VIP channel in Slack, but it’s not good to think that ABEJA is just playing with VIP, so I decided to send it to Tech a little this time. In this article, I’ll try the following two stories. If it’s hard to understand, maybe you can jump to the bottom and see the graph.

item.title: [Python] Create a chatbot that supports free input with Word2Vec
item.description: This article is the first day article of [Zeals Advent Calendar 2019](https://qiita.com/advent-calendar/2019/zeals). Nice to meet you. This is Tamaki, who will join Zeals from the next fiscal year. Zeals operates a chatbot technology called chat commerce. Also, I am currently researching natural language processing at university. There are conversations in which bots do not have natural language processing, but I thought it would be interesting to add natural language processing technology to them, so I decided to make this the subject of this article.

item.title: [Python] Vectorize sentences and search for similar sentences
item.description: I tried searching for similar sentences with Doc2Vec, so I will introduce the implementation. What is #Doc2Vec In order for a computer to process natural language, human words must first have a value that the computer can handle. Word2Vec exists as a method to vectorize the meaning of words. For details, the link is very easy to understand, but roughly speaking, it expresses that word in a list of n words before and after.
